docs.title: Homelab
docs.text:
This is a collection of Helm charts for use in homelabs.

This repository utilizes GitHub workflows to automate testing, updating and publishing Helm charts.

docs.title: Common library
docs.text: This Helm library chart is used to build application charts.

docs.title: Workload
docs.text:
The workload key defines the workload type. The value can be deployment, statefulset, daemonset, job, or cronjob. The default is null which can be useful to create only top-level objects e.g. configmap, secret, extraObjects.

workload: deployment

docs.title: ConfigMap
docs.text:
The configmap key defines a map, each key/value pair is a unique ConfigMap. The key can be used to reference the specific ConfigMap. The ConfigMap data is stored unied the data key. The values can be static values or templates.

configmap:
  default:
    data:
      CONFIG_PATH: /config
      PORT: "{{ .Values.service.ports.default.port }}"

Examples using a ConfigMap.

envFrom:
  default:
    type: configmap

persistence:
  config:
    enabled: true
    type: configmap

docs.title: Secret
docs.text:
The secret key defines a map, each key/value pair is a unique Secret. The key can be used to reference the specific Secret. The Secret data is stored unied the data key. The values can be static values or templates.

secret:
  default:
    data:
      PASSWORD: abcd1234

Examples using a Secret.

envFrom:
  default:
    type: secret

persistence:
  config:
    enabled: true
    type: secret

docs.title: Persistence
docs.text:
The persistence key is a map, the keys are unique identifiers for the volume. Each volume is disabled by default. The type can be configmap, emptydir, hostpath, nfs, pvc, or secret.

persistence:
  config:
    enabled: true
    type: emptydir

docs.title: Service
docs.text:
The service key defines the service for the workflow. Each workflow has a single service. Each key/value under ports defines a single backend. The key can be used to reference the service port.

service:
  ports:
    default:
      port: 80

docs.title: Ingress
docs.text:
The ingress key defines the ingress for the workflow. Each workload has a single ingress, which is disabled by default. Each value under hosts is a unique path.

ingress:
  enabled: true
  hosts:
  - name: default

docs.title: TLS
docs.text:
TLS is enabled by setting ingress.tls.enabled to true. The secretName should reference a secret containing a key/cert pair.

ingress:
  enabled: true
  hosts:
  - name: default
  tls:
    enabled: true
    secretName: tls-certs

docs.title: Network Policy
docs.text:
The networkPolicy key defines the network policy for the workflow. Each workflow has a single network policy, which is disabled by default. The default network policy adds a single rule for ingress and blocks egress. Additional ingress/egress rules can be added under the ingress and egress keys. To default ingress/egress rules can be disabled with disableDefaultEgress and disableDefaultIngress keys.

networkPolicy:
  enabled: true

docs.title: Addons
docs.text: The common library provides addons that are attached as extraContainers.

docs.title: Visual Studio Code
docs.text:
This addon will attach a sidecar running Visual Code Studio. The addons uses the ghcr.io/linuxserver/code-server container. The minimal configuration requires an ingress and persistence be defined.

addons:
  codeserver:
    enabled: true
    ingress:
      enabled: false
      hosts:
      - name: codeserver
        host:
    persistence:
      config:
        type: pvc

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This repository provides many homelab related Helm charts. There is a common library designed to simplify creating new Helm charts.

docs.title: Adding chart repository
docs.text:
To install the Helm charts provided by this repository you'll need to install Helm and add this repository.

helm repo add homelab https://jasonb5.github.io/charts

docs.title: List charts
docs.text:
List the charts available in the repository.

helm search repo homelab

docs.title: Install a chart
docs.text:
A Helm chart can be install with the following command.

helm install homelab/<chart name> --generate-name

docs.title: Creating a new chart
docs.text:
A copier template is provided to create new Helm charts. The template uses the common library to build the chart. It also provides scaffolding for common dependencies e.g. Redis, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL.

pip install copier

make new-chart
